segments.script: Blockchain is a distributed digital ledger that records transactions across multiple computers. Each block contains a timestamp and transaction data, and is linked to the previous block through cryptographic hashes.
segments.visuals: Animation showing linked blocks forming a chain.

segments.script: Consensus mechanisms ensure all participants agree on the ledger state. Popular methods include Proof of Work and Proof of Stake, where validators lock up tokens as collateral.
segments.visuals: Comparison diagram of different consensus methods.

segments.script: Smart contracts are self-executing programs that run on blockchain networks. They automatically enforce agreements between parties without needing intermediaries.
